intro: Megalastrum andicola, commonly known as the Andean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its habitat. Megalastrum andicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
